question_text: Why is DDR memory not backward compatible with previous DDR versions?
answer_options: Because it requires a different CPU architecture
Because of differing physical keying and electrical characteristics
Because it is only supported on laptops
Because earlier DDR versions lack heat spreaders
correct_answer: Because of differing physical keying and electrical characteristics
explanation: Each DDR generation has different key notches and electrical requirements, preventing physical and functional compatibility between versions.
